page.title: 13THE BROADWAY TRUST
page.content: In 1962 a group of people met who were concerned for the preservation of {Broadway}as it was at that time. {The Civic Trust}was approached and with its approval{The Broadway Trust came into being. The source of income is the subscriptions of the members. Several prominent{Broadway}people were founder members of the Trust which exists to promote and encourage high standards of architecture, town planning and landscaping. The villagers are encouraged to preserve the historical and rural character of {Broadway.}The Trust also exists to forestall and prevent ugliness whether private or public. There are no overhead wires in{Broadway.}It is a conservation area. The Trust owns land on{Broadway Hill}including the {Lordship of the Manor}thus enabling it to oversee the village greens.
